item.title: Order Taking, Pain Killers, and Desperation: Avoiding Middling Startup Outcomes
item.description: When I started Mirage, I went hunting for “desperate” customers to validate direction. The playbook for enterprise seemed straightforward: cold outreach → design partners → first cohort. It worked. But then I learned a crucial lesson that turned my assumptions upside down: desperation != urgency. In enterprises, the person feeling the pain rarely controls the budget. Executive buyers get looped in, procurement cycles kick off, and committees form. If a problem isn’t truly urgent, these deals turn into molasses.
